This page collects papers, books, articles, videos, and other resources suggested by our community for potential future discussions. We welcome suggestions that align with our focus on impactful and seminal machine learning content.

## Current Suggestions

- [The Illusion of Thinking: Understanding the Strengths and Limitations of Reasoning Models via the Lens of Problem Complexity](https://machinelearning.apple.com/research/illusion-of-thinking) (discussing November 2025)
- [AI as Normal Technology](https://knightcolumbia.org/content/ai-as-normal-technology) (discussed October 2025)
- [On the Theoretical Limitations of Embedding-Based Retrieval](https://arxiv.org/abs/2508.21038) (discussed September 2025)
- [Energy-Based Transformers are Scalable Learners and Thinkers](https://arxiv.org/abs/2507.02092)
- [Angles Don't Lie: Unlocking Training-Efficient RL Through the Model's Own Signals](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.02281)
- [Large Language Model Hacking: Quantifying the Hidden Risks of Using LLMs for Text Annotation](https://arxiv.org/abs/2509.08825)
- [Text-to-LoRA: Instant Transformer Adaption](https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.06105)
- [Poisoning Attacks on LLMs Require a Near-constant Number of Poison Sample](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.07192)
- [Petri: An open-source auditing tool to accelerate AI safety research](https://alignment.anthropic.com/2025/petri/)
- [Holistic Agent Leaderboard: The Missing Infrastructure for AI Agent Evaluation](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.11977)
- [Alignment Faking in Large Language Models](https://arxiv.org/abs/2412.14093)
- [MolmoAct: Action Reasoning Models that can Reason in Space](https://arxiv.org/abs/2508.07917)

## How to Suggest Papers

Have a paper, book chapter, news article, lecture, or other resource you think would spark great discussion? You can:

- Contact the organizer directly
- Submit a suggestion via [GitHub issue](https://github.com/AustinMLJournalClub/AustinMLJournalClub.github.io/issues)
- Bring it up during our monthly meetings

We look for content that is impactful, thought-provoking, or offers practical insights into how ML/AI works in practice, regardless of format or technical complexity.
